title: Belfast community join forces to make sure no child goes without this Christmas
body_text:
Belfast community join forces to make sure no child goes without this Christmas
"We want to ease the burden on local families"
A tight-knit Belfast community has come together to make sure that no child goes without this Christmas.
With prices of food and utility bills soaring, the added pressure of the festive period can make families feel like they have nowhere to turn to.
One community centre has recognised those challenges, and have expanded their annual toy appeal.
Read more: Belfast community bereaved by suicide launch major awareness drive
Supported by local businesses in the wider Lenadoon community of West Belfast, the Glen Community Parent Youth Group and Lenadoon Women's Group will be distributing toys to young people in the area next month.
Robert Sands, who is coordinating the appeal, said: "We are encouraging people to support the appeal by leaving new, unwrapped toys with age details into us.
"We don't forget about that older age group too, and are also appealing for vouchers for local teenagers too, which can also be dropped off at local collection points.
"This wouldn't be possible with the joined up approach with local schools, sporting organisations and businesses who have agreed to sponsor the appeal this year."
Schools involved in the Christmas appeal are St Oliver Plunkett Primary, Bunscoil Phobal Feirste and St Gerard's. Local business Hair by Sesosi is also continuing to support in the group's efforts/
Sporting support has also come in strength through:
- Padraig Sairseil C.L.G.
- Naomh Pól C.L.G.
- Tullymore Swifts F.C.
- Donegal Celtic F.C.
- Acquinas F.C.
- Fonacab Soccer Development League
- Olympus Gym West Belfast
- Lab Gym
Robert added: "As a group, we are asking people, if they are in a position to, to contribute to this appeal, to ease the burden on local families.
"Last year we were blown away by the response to the appeal and over 200 local children and young people had a brighter fun filled Christmas as a result of the generosity of local people."
Donations for the Toy Appeal can be left at the Glen Community Complex between 9am – 9pm (Mon – Fri), if any other businesses wish to get involved or for more information, ring Robert or Karen at 02890 585544.
The Toy Appeal will conclude on Friday December 8 to allow distribution to families.
For more information on how to help, or if you are in need of support, please reach out to Glen Community Parent Youth Group here.
